docna.cdata!:
Kenya - Structural Adjustment Credit :
            Credit 0999 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Kenya - Structural Adjustment
            Credit : Credit 0999 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The credits would provide support for a
            program of economic measures agreed upon with the Government
            and outlined in a Letter of Intent from the Government to
            the Association designed to adjust the foreign trade regime
            and industrial structure. Foreign exchange would be used for
            essential imports of raw materials, intermediate goods,
            spare parts and balancing equipment. Counterpart funds would
            be used for development-related expenditures in the Central
            Government budget. Only goods purchased from Bank Group
            member countries and Switzerland would be eligible for
            reimbursement. Purchases by private firms would be on the
            basis of normal commercial practices. Purchases by
            parastatals would follow Kenya Government regulations but
            all contracts in excess of US$5 million would be subject to
            international competitive bidding.
